intro: Pagamea coriacea var. acuta, commonly known as the rough pagamea, is a shrub native to parts of southern Africa. It is characterized by its thick, leathery leaves that are covered in a rough, textured surface. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in clusters during the warmer months. It is drought-tolerant and thrives in well-drained soils, making it suitable for xeriscaping. Its unique foliage makes it a popular choice for ornamental gardening in arid regions.
